availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p: On motion of he is hereby appointed to fill the vacancy in the office of sheriff of this county occasioned by the removal of , he having refused to execute Bond for the collection of the revenue &Samuel A. DavisJohn W. Gregoryc, said Davis to act until the next August election and until his successor then chosen shall qualify, Whereupon said Davis took the oaths prescribed by law and the constitution and together with, , , H MunchhoffAbner Davis and his sureties executed covenant to the Commonwealth conditioned as required by law.George W. Arm J. J. JonesA. J. Harris
I certify that the above is a true copy made ^in^ at the Union County Court held on Monday the 6th day of Feby 1865.

clkH. W. Waggener
By r D CJ M Waggene
unty CourtUnion Co
Union Co
Sheriff
apptd
Recd
5th Apl 1865
